item.title: Report X-2023071246
item.description:
Report X-2023071246

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T00:34:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: KLAMATH FALLS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 18th, 2023 the CBTX 742401 was found leaking vapor pressure through the vacuum relief valve. The leak was identified by ODOT Hazmat Inspector C Kuenzi. The car was isolated for safe inspection by a BNSF contractor. Inspection confirmed that vapor was releasing through the VRV. Responders attempted to vent the car and remove the VRV to put a plug in its place to secure the release. The threaded VRV was unable to be removed by responders. In consultation with the shipper, it was determined to clean and purge the car and ship to shop for repair under an OTMA. An inspection can be performed at that time to determine the cause of release through the VRV. There was no cleanup as all vapor dissipated. Release estimates are based upon observations of the responders.
